description:
After installing all the nova services to a single node, I ran

services --status-all

and get this for the nova-services. 

 [ ? ]  nova-api
 [ ? ]  nova-compute
 [ ? ]  nova-network
 [ ? ]  nova-objectstore
 [ ? ]  nova-scheduler

I think they are running and should reflect that with a [+].
title: All the nova- services show up as [?] with services --status-all

comments.content:
( Assuming that nova was installed on Ubuntu 10.10 system via apt-get packages from ppa )

I'm not an expert on this, but I think this is a Ubuntu bug.

<warning> long winded answer below </warning>

Due to Ubuntu's partial move to using upstart scripts, the /usr/bin/service command is a bit schizophrenic about checking for service status. If you just issue a single status query like 

	# sudo service nova-compute status
	nova-compute start/running, process 5408

it uses the upstart config file in /etc/init/ to find out if nova-compute is running. However, if you give it the --status-all flag like this

	$ service --status-all
        ... snip ...
 	[ ? ]  nova-api
 	[ ? ]  nova-compute
 	[ ? ]  nova-instancemonitor
 	[ ? ]  nova-network
 	[ ? ]  nova-objectstore
 	[ ? ]  nova-scheduler
 	[ ? ]  nova-volume
       ... snip ...

it goes down a different code path ... which seems a bit brain dead. Instead of checking each upstart config file and then falling back to checking /etc/init.d/ startup scripts, it just checks the /etc/init.d startup script for a status command with this code:

	if ! grep -qs "\Wstatus)" "$SERVICE"; then
            #printf " %s %-60s %s\n" "[?]" "$SERVICE:" "unknown" 1>&2
            echo " [ ? ]  $SERVICE" 1>&2
            continue

and as the nova /etc/init.d startup scripts don’t have this line (because we are simply symlink-ing to /lib/init/upstart-job which doesn’t have the whitespace before the status) on line 41), we get the [ ? ] . This appears to be the case with every other upstart service also.

You can fix this by simply editing /lib/init/upstart-job and adding a single space before “status)” of line 41. When I did that and re-ran the command, I got

	$ sudo service --status-all
	... snip ...
	[ + ]  nova-api
 	[ + ]  nova-compute
 	[ + ]  nova-instancemonitor
 	[ + ]  nova-network
 	[ + ]  nova-objectstore
 	[ + ]  nova-scheduler
 	[ + ]  nova-volume
       .... snip ...

I recommend closing this bug and refiling it on Ubuntu 10.10's service command.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ken-pepple

comments.content: Thanks for the explanation, Ken! Editing /lib/init/upstart-job worked. I'll close the bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~annegentle
